awd_titl_txt: Doctoral Dissertation Research:  Mobilization in the American Pro-Life Movement
awd_abstract_narration:
SES  0000353
PI:  Theda Skocpol, Ziad Munson


This project studies how individuals are recruited into, and mobilized to activity within, pro-life movements.  The design draws on ideas from social movements, religion, and political sociology;  it emphasizes the role of ideas in this social movement.  The research uses documents produced by pro-life groups, and interviews with both activists and non-activists.  Four sites that represent different religious composition, demographic characteristics, and levels of interest in the pro-life movement have been chosen: Boston, Minneapolis, Oklahoma City, and Charleston.  Outcomes of this project should include a fuller understanding of the role(s) of religion in social activism, and conditions and processes of mobilization of social movements in contemporary U.S. society.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral and Economic Sciences
